page.title: 20STAMBOURNE: SOCIAL STRUCTURE
page.content: Until 5 or 10 years ago it seemed that Stambourne was becoming a village of old people. Since that time more families with children have moved in, so that there is now a wide age-range in the population. The only employment in the village is farming, haulage and service industries: workers commute to London, Cambridge, Haverhill, Halstead &c. There are several families whose members have lived in the village all their lives, or near-by. Several others have moved from the N. and E. suburbs of London. Property in Stambourne is slightly cheaper than further south (eg. Bardfield) or east (nearer Sudbury). Newcomers to the village have been welcomed into existing institutions and contribute to them, but their presence causes changes.
